name: Apex Temple Court Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very good located, close to next tube station "temple". Nice area for foreign tourists like us (Swiss people). If entering the room the first time -you probablably will say WOW. VERY nice rooms. Nice to have a drink outside in the "courtyard". The service at the bar area was not very professional, always long waiting times, missing orders, etc. But we have taken it very EASY, because we spent our short vacation time there.
reviews.title: great stay, cool interiour design, nice neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GERMAN: Wir waren sehr positiv überrascht ab der tollen Qualität des Hotels. Service war mit Ausnahme der Bar sehr professionell. Das Zimmer war "WOW" sehr toll und modern eingerichtet. Das Hotel toll im Temple Court District eingebettet. Ideal für Musical Besuche oder auch für ins Barbecoa. Architektonisch sehr reizvoll (bei gutem Wetter) im Hof auf der Hinterseite des Hotels einen Drink zu zelebrieren. Uns hat's sehr gut gefallen.
reviews.title: So wonderful after a long flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: After 22 hours of air travel time, it was so wonderful to enjoy the luxury and comfort offered by this hotel. The bed was soft, and the room was modern and tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Apex Temple Court - fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was fantastic, just a short bus or train trip to parliament square.
reviews.title: weekend in london at apex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you can book well in advance, and don't mind paying in full in advance, then there are some great deals to be had too.
reviews.title: Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at this hotel on a room only basis after getting a good deal through a travel offer website (£99 per night).
reviews.title: Pretty decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's about a ten minute walk from Chancery Lane tube and is easy enough to find when you work out the way, although we prefer to be a bit nearer to an underground station.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Inside everything is shiny and new and the room we had was spacious with a decent sized bed, although I did think it was a bit short which could pose problems if you're six feet plus (we're not!)
reviews.title: wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was lots of wardrobe space, a massive flat screen telly, ipod dock and a double seat to watch the TV. The bathroom was a good size and there was a fantastic walk in shower.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel that is thoroughly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My wife found the pillows a bit too high for her but reception sorted her out with smaller ones on the second night.
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel-good London base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived and the reception was very apologetic and offered us to be taken care of at the bar while we wait. We totally didn't mind since we were there way before check in time, but it was so nice to be taken care of and not be shoved and told "the check in is at 4:30". We were promptly shown to our suite after a nice glass of chardonnay. And it was so worth the extra L10 for the upgrade. It was huge, especially for European standard, and super modern and beautiful. I especially like the extra touches like the facial sprays.
reviews.title: Friendly and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also very impressed with the stunningly modern and beautiful entry area, but also a little timid because we were traveling with our 6 year old. And of course, as he was running around; he ran into a glass wall and was making a ruckus. Everyone jumped out of their station to make sure he was OK and even gave him candy to make him feel better. I think he was crying more out of embarrassment than pain, but it sure was appreciated.
reviews.title: Brilliant!
Not far from oxo tower
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to any couples or even family traveling with young kids. The junior suite was big enough for 2 adults and 2 kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here because we ended up coming to London one day early and wasn't happy with the price we were quoted to extend our existing hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be honest, I really wish we'd stayed at this hotel the whole time as Citadines Holborn wasn't as comfortable as we remembered it to be.
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great customer service received from the moment we arrived to the moment we left from the attentive and personable reception staff to the room service staff. I was impressed the reception staff even remembered the name of the show we went to see earlier in the day and enquired whether we enjoyed it!
reviews.title: Tucked away but what a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bags were waiting for us in the room when we arrived after the show and it was a welcome sight to see a tastefully decorated room, a huge bathroom both very clean and modern. We had the twin room and the beds were so comfortable and made for a great nights sleep. Loved the little touches from the temperature controlled room, Bose sound system, huge tv and a cute rubber duck in the bathroom.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT, TRANQUIL HOTEL IN GREAT CITY/THEATRELAND LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: Overall, even though the hotel is slightly tucked away it is only a short walk from Temple tube stop and Victoria Embankment with its view across The Thames over towards The Shard, London Eye, Westminster Abbey and Big Ben. Would definitely come back to stay and would recommend.
reviews.title: Fab weekend stay at apex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My fiancée and I stayed at this hotel on in January 2013; it was a treat to my fiancée for his 50th Birthday. From me booking this hotel, to the welcome email before arriving, to the greeting from staff on the day of arrival and the checking out, we could not have been treated any better.
reviews.title: Really nive hotel in the middle of London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were so friendly and professional, we received such a nice welcome to the hotel, wishing my Fiancée a Happy Birthday and with them giving us an upgrade to our room, plus a drinks voucher and chocolates in our room, far more than we would have ever expected or dreamed of.
reviews.title: Spacious and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Everything was perfect, amazing views and very comfortable room! Very well placed as well in the city center and close to the Thames. I look forward to going back!
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend for business and family!
reviews.title: Birthday Treat
Almost perfect
reviews.text: Excellent hotel with great service within easy walking distance of the Embankment. We combined our stay with a meal and a visit to the Haymarket Theatre a £10 taxi ride away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had lunch in the hotel and firstly the food order was taken incorrectly then one part of the order did not taste good, we advise the staff and they refunded the money for that item quickly and efficiently which was good.
reviews.title: Peaceful pampering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's difficult to find such a great hotel for the requested price in London. Big rooms, great facilities, very good breakfast.
reviews.title: great modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited March 2012, also using TravelZoo promotion.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were initially offered a room with no bath, but I upgraded to room with its own lounge. Original offer was £100 for 1 night, and this increased price by £90 odd FYI.
reviews.title: An oasis of boutique calm in the bustling court district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely done, comfortable bed. Decent shower. Lounge upgrade nice - defn worth having if you're staying for a few days on business etc.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Sky HD in our room with loads of channels. Oh and the main TV has external AV inputs like HDMI, PCI, USB, phono etc to use it as large monitor. Didn't use it personally but very impressed to have it as seperate connection centre.
reviews.title: Lovely peaceful haven in the heart of the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel in Fleet Street when we eventually found it. Post code takes you to the back entrance down a very narrow street, the taxi driver wasn;'t too impressed. There is another entrance actually on Fleet Street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms decorated lovely with all mod cons such as flat screen tv, ipod dock. Fridge and water in room. Elemis toiletries, fab bath and seperate large shower . Bed was so comfortable, very wide. Rooms are not over large.
reviews.title: Top Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lovely bar, nice atmosphere, great Irish coffees.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: Best bed I've ever slept in!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Apex Temple Court Hotel at 10am on 24th March to be told that we had been upgraded to a superior room and that our room was ready, bonus. It was a lovely spacious room with tea and coffee facilites, fridge and safe. We realised when we got back to the hotel that night, that the bedding was feather, husband has allergies. We informed the night staff and they replaced the pillows but they only had one single none feather quilt which wasn't a problem as I had the double to myself. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel for the day after we checked out which was very helpful. Definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great Service and Awesome Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this newly opened hotel because we were offered an excellent rate for a four star hotel and we were not disappointed. The room was very comfortable, lots of storage space and surfaces, a huge comfortable bed, lovely bathroom and great TV with hundreds of global channels. Also very quiet. Staff good at responding to problems. Wifi was free and when I had a problem with it they offered 24hr support which I thought was impressive (the issue resolved itself the next day). Plenty of local cafes for breakfast as an alternative.
reviews.title: Good quality and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: Just back from a long weekend at the Apex Temple Court. This is a new hotel which is stylish, modern and has excellent staff. Standard King room was spacious with a great shower and fabulous Elemis products. Plenty of room to hang clothes and store luggage. Facilities to make drinks are provided and topped up each day. Spotless room and bathroom again refreshed each day if required. Hairdryer also provided. Check in was smooth but they do take a £90 credit card deposit in advance which is refunded 2-3 days after your stay if not used. Wifi in room a bonus and also free use of two computers on the lobby. The greeter outside was always friendly and remembered us each time we passed. All staff were polite and professional. A fire alarm at midnight on our last day obviously could not be helped and we had a polite letter of apology outside the room in the morning. Location was excellent with lots of buses directly outside and easy to walk everywhere too. This is a real gem in the City!
reviews.title: Fabulous in Fleet St!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only booked on a 'room only basis', so didn't in fact use the bar or the restaurant. However the reception staff were always happy, polite and helpful. The Hotel is actually so well situated, close to other bars, restaurants and fantastic for site seeing, being situated in the heart of London. The internet access in close to reception was very handy but the room was fabulous. Very spacious with a wonderful bathroom, with large bath and large seperate shower. We couldn't have asked for more. And because the hotel is set back through a courtyard, the room we had was set far back, so no road noise at all, which in a large city is a big bonus. The only minor niggle was finding somewhere close enough to park but I guess that's what you have to expect in London, Overall very satisfied indeed.
reviews.title: Very Happy with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the temple Court hotel for 2 nights 9 - 11 March. It was quite difficult to find as it is set back off the main road through an archway. Once we did find it though it was a real treat! The room was very luxurious and comfortable. Great to have the Bose docking system! The Decor of the Hotel is very stylish. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had breakfast on the Sunday morning. The food was of a high standard though there appeared to be a few teething problems with the service. We had to ask 3 times for our toast and twice for coffee. Also our cooked breakfast took a long time to arrive. Luckily we were not in a particular hurry so just went with it, however, if you had wanted to be out at a certain time it could have been a problem. We would certrainly stay at the Hotel in the future and would recommend it.
reviews.title: High Class Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my mum and my aunt on March 2012 for 2 nights and I could have not wished for better! The hotel is warm and relaxing to the eyes and mind, beautiful choice of furniture and colours...coupled to very friendly and professional members of staff and you have a fantastic combination! It was the perfect place for a family meeting and the hotel location is amazing. I loved the elephant at the entrance and the fact that every room has a Bose base for your iPhone and iPod music! Really looking forwards being back and will recommend to friends and family!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel and fantastic staff!

aka: Apex Temple Court Hotel London, England
description: Located in the City, just off Fleet Street and a short walk to Covent Garden this contemporary four star deluxe hotel has 184 stylish en-suite rooms. Designed for comfort, the rooms include LED 3D TV incl.Sky Sports, Bose SoundDock for MP3 players, large desk, Free Wi-Fi internet access and local calls, fridge, safe, water, coffee & tea, luxury toiletries, iron and ironing board. The stylish bathrooms offer bath with separate spacious walk-in showers. Hotel facilities include Chambers Bar and Restaurant and Gym.
